main_definition: To grasp, hold, or receive something with the hands.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To move or begin to move (a vehicle).
meanings_and_examples.example: I will take the bus to work tomorrow.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To receive and start using something.
meanings_and_examples.example: She took a loan from the bank to buy her house.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To accept or agree to (an idea, plan, etc.).
meanings_and_examples.example: He takes your suggestion into consideration.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To assume responsibility for someone or something.
meanings_and_examples.example: I will take care of the dog while you're away.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To capture a photograph with a camera.
meanings_and_examples.example: He likes to take pictures during his travels.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To put into use or employ (an idea, plan, etc.).
meanings_and_examples.example: We will take your proposal and start implementing it next week.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To come into possession of something by purchase.
meanings_and_examples.example: She took a beautiful vase from the antique store.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To hold onto or keep (a person).
meanings_and_examples.example: The police will take him into custody for questioning.
He took a hammer to the broken window.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To stop (a machine, etc.) from working or moving.
meanings_and_examples.example: The power outage caused all the equipment to take.
